"Well," The girl sighs, "All of the candy we sell here is homemade. But I found out that when you try your own recipes enough, it all starts to blend together, it gets hard to notice when you're doing something wrong. So I decided to hire someone who could help me out, try what I make, make sure everything meets our quality standards, stuff like that." She shrugs, "Are you interested?"

Getting paid to eat candy? That sounds fun! Amy was a bit of a cook herself, but she'd never tried making candy before. Maybe she could learn something. Maybe even make something special enough for that certain someone...

1352.content:
Blaze always wondered how the Sol emeralds knew when to send Blaze to mobius, but for once, it didn't take long at all for her to learn why. Upon her arrival, she spots a fleet of eggman battle ships up in the atmosphere. Or rather, she was teleported directly onto the main ship in the center.

It took equally as little for the robot security to notice her, sirens wailing, and badniks charging toward.

Though Blaze made short work of many of them, one was able to get the best of her, grabbing and holding her in it's metallic arms.

"Ho ho!" Eggman's voice boomed over the intercom, "I was expecting someone else, but you should do just as well!!!"

Blaze cared little for what that could mean. Concentrating, she summonef the power of the Sol Emeralds, becoming Burning Blaze. She blasted through everything thrown in her way, eventually making it to the main control room, and a very scared Eggman.

"N-now hold on!" He stammered, "I was just kidding! I'll turn over a new leaf, I swear!"

Blaze couldn't help but smirk.

"What's this?" She teased, "Showing remorse? Had you behaved yourself, I would not have to break your toys."

Hmm. That sounded better in her head.

Suddenly, the mad doctor's scared expression turned to a smirk.

"Gotcha!" He cried, pressing a button

Before Blaze could react, pylons rose from the ground, ensnaring her in some sort of energy field. Electricity erupted, and Blaze watched in horror as her and the Sol emeralds were drained of power, turning grey and lifeless.

Outside, this power charged a massive weapon on the side of tge ship. This weapon fired, and the planet seemed to crack and split into pieces, shadowy tendrils snaking between the chunks.

But Blaze was hardly able to notice. Just as she was drained of Sol energy, she felt a new kind of power begin to seep into her. A darker, far more unstable power.

Overwhelmed, she fell to her knees, shaking as changes began to take hold. Her teeth sharpened into fangs, Her gloves ripped away, revealing claws, and her whole body began to bulk, straining against her clothes. Her chest pulsed outward, as did her hips and rear. Her stomach tighted, forming abs. Her arms developed powerful muscle, tearing through her sleeves.

"Gah!" She gasped, finding it hard to breathe as her top became tighter and tighter, until...

Releif! The collar ripped open, her bosom now freed.

Finally, the machine seemed to settle, powering down, and allowing Blaze a look at what had been done to the world.

"You've really.... done it this time..." Blaze panted, voice feeling course

"That's a good look for you!" He teased, "Festive!"

Blaze, enraged, lunged toward the doctor, only for him to deactivate the airlock, sending her out of the ship, and tumbling helplessly toward the splintered planet...
